intro: Apoballis mutata, commonly known as the Cape mountain heath, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Ericaceae and is characterized by its dense, shrub-like growth habit. The plant produces small, bell-shaped flowers that are typically pink or white in color. It thrives in well-drained, acidic soils and is often found in rocky or mountainous regions. Apoballis mutata is adapted to dry conditions and is considered a hardy, drought-resistant species.
